instance.context:
prerecorded laughter added to the soundtrack of a radio or
television_show ;

workplace consisting of a room or building where movies or
television_shows or radio programs are produced and recorded ;

an attention-getting opening presented at the start of a
television_show ;

worker who moves the camera around while a film or
television_show is being made ;

United_States comedian who pioneered comedy
television_shows ;

United_States comedienne who starred in early
television_shows with Sid_Caesar ;

a payment that is made to a performer or writer or director of a
television_show or commercial that is paid for every repeat showing ;

the point_in_time at which an entertainment ( a movie or
television_show etc. ) is scheduled to begin ;
